reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've waited over 3 years for this game since I backed the kickstarted and I got to say that I'm not impressed at all. The sheer amount of content is very disturbing and the poor animations when running and hitting made the game feel very stale. I got no enjoyment out of slaying all those zombies. It just felt plain and boring. I want satisfaction out of dominating zombies and with smoother animations I think the game would be much more enjoyable.

Hopefully this game will be worth coming back to at a later date, but at the moment I can't recommend it.
voteText: 73 of 94 people (78%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a backer of the Kickstarter, maybe I'm just rationalizing my donation, but I'm really just happy they're still working on the game after so long and am pleasantly surprised with what they have so far because for months at a time I would forget the game even exists only to check up on it every now and then forget about it again. They could've easily just have dropped the project long ago with the difficulties they were having and I wouldn't have even noticed, so I really admire their dedication to it and the backers.

With that said, the game still needs a ton of work done on it, but I feel like they have a pretty solid foundation with pretty much all the basic gameplay elements laid out. They really just need to add more of everything, smooth out the controls and combat, and of course do a lot of bug testing and gameplay balancing. The game is pretty playable the way it is at the moment, but lacking so many of the promised gameplay elements you might do everything there is to do pretty quickly and grow tired of it.

Still, if the concept appeals to you and you like these kinds of games, it may be worth looking into and see if you'd enjoy watching it develop into a fully fleshed out game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For an early access, its pretty good!

Its a action third person slaying zombie game with objectives ( its pretty basic for now)

There is currently 2 classes, ( 6 on release if i read right )

There is a some customization options (guns, melee weapons and clothing and there  more to come )

Gameplay is good but the animations  could be more fluid , so its a good thing that this game is in early access because the devs can work on this and others improvements to make this game one the best zombie slaying third person action game.

Cons:  - Melee and ranged combat, its not that bad but its still need some adjustment.

Anyway , if you got the money and you love zombie slaying games than this is for you, buy without restraint.

* May change during early access

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I highly recommend this game.

Is it perfect? Nope.
Does it have fun issues like Zombies coming through doors? Yeah, occasionally, But so does DayZ and that's been out since December 2013.

They're not the same game of course. DayZ is survival and this is, well fun.

You get to run around as a kid, customize your character to wear gas masks, have backpacks and a dog. Plastic baseball bat? You've got it. Nail guns (not child friendly) they're there too.
Paintball gun? Yep.

Remember those paper cutters you had in school that you used to be terrified of because you thought your hand was gonna get chopped right off? Well those are weapons too.

It needs some work, sometimes in Multiplayer you'll get locked in place. Sometimes one of your friends is just floating and sliding about, but on his screen he's being a bad A 3rd grader. No one is judging.
It's challenging enough that it holds my interest.

I posted a screenshot and the dev commented. How cool is that? They're paying attention.

it's really easy to get into a game and play when you've only got a few minutes to kill, and if you want to invest more time I'm sure it's the same level of easy.

I don't normally write reviews, but I saw this one had mixed reviews on the first day, and I don't think that's fair. It's fun, Worth the 15 dollars in my book and I've only played for a little over an hour and a half, however, I see myself putting a lot more into it.

If you're on the fence, watch some gameplay or streams of it, if you're a fan of supporting devs get this, but remember it's in Early Access so as mentioned, there will be some issues.

If you have no desire to play this then you probably didn't have a childhood where you got to play on a playground and pretend you were saving all your friends from monsters.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI waited a long time for this game. I followed the Kickstarter campaign, the forum updates and finally the Steam early access. I feel like I need an option for in between Yes and No. I like the art style, the options for customization, the music and the a lot of the gameplay. I have a huge problem with the camera work (more on that later) and the seeming lack of story/objective. I understand that this is a work in progress so here is what I'd like to see; the option for story mode and simple run and gun gameplay. More character options. More levels. Achievements. You see where I'm going. I think this is a good foundation and after the bugs are worked out and more content is added Zombie Playground will be a great addition to your game library. Fingers crossed.

Early Access Review

This game is good but you've got to like this sort of game to get enjoyment out of it.

It needs more work done to it but so far it's quite fun, there's not a lot to do at the moment but there's still a few different missions to do and the developers are working towards adding new stuff into it, not too sure if online is any good as only played the solo mode.

Pros:

It's a zombie game.
It has an objective marker to show you where to go.

Cons:
Combat isn't the best. It locks you on to a zombie and forces you to strike in that certain direction which takes some of the freedom out of it.

This review probably isn't the best in terms of explaining the game but hopefully helpful enough for you to decide if you want to try it out :D I haven't played a lot of this game so there's possibly a lot of stuff I'm missing but this is what I picked up from the beginning of the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Why do children never get to be protagonists in zombie games? Are they not equipped to handle such peril? Perhaps their death would be taken too harshly by the audience? Zombie Playground pulls off the seemingly impossible, delivering superb class-based arena combat featuring children against hordes of the undead. The enemies and environments are endearingly creepy. The cartoon style with its stylistic black blood, serves greatly to ensure that even while eviscerating tens of opponents with a nailgun, the game never feels like it is taking things too far. Just look at the sparkles! OOH!

Class-based means this game is infinitely more fun with a friend or two, but even alone the fluid controls and easy-to-master combo system makes Zombie Playground just feel nice to play. Currently only two classes are available, the Bully which takes on a Berserker role and the Rascal who serves as more of a Scout. The dynamic works well enough, with the Scout finding the path of least resistance and the Bully keeping it clear. However, with only one level to explore maybe double-Bully is the way to go. As more classes are added the game will develop some much needed complexity.

Customization is extremely vast in this game. Hair, clothing, and accessories abound to ensure that no two survivors will look the same. You can even choose between a few different school-related weapons. I experimented briefly with the level-up system, which gives a fair incentive to continue playing. Eventually you will unlock all of the few available game modes, and find yourself waiting for the next update. There is a lot to love about this game and it is an extremely promising Early Access title, but the variety will need to be stepped up if it hopes to make itself known in the horde of zombie games available today.

I greatly enjoyed my time with Zombie Playground, but lack of variety hurts this game a lot. The difficulty score is flogged by the beat-em-up nature of the game and the sheer amount of items dropped. This games unique aesthetic and fluid controls are what eventually won me over. This game could surely be amongst the greats if it offered a more complex combat system and maybe some RPG elements. If it seems like something you would enjoy, please leave a comment on the youtube video mentioned previously and your name will be entered to win one of two Steam keys. Thanks to Stealth Studios, and I can‚Äôt wait to see whats in store for the future of Zombie Playground.

Gameplay:

Controls- 10/10
Fun Factor- 8/10
Difficulty- 6/10
Replayability- 2/10
Innovation- 7/10

Aesthetic:

Graphics- 10/10
Music- 8/10
Sound FX- 6/10
Story/Lore- 0/10
Level Design- 7/10

Final Score: 64/100 for graphics, controls, and fun factor.
Summary: Arena-shooter about kids cleansing their school of zombies. Oozes style and potential.
Verdict: Lacking content at the moment. With more classes/levels/unlocks this game will become a real treat.

Check out the full text/photo review here: http://www.indiegamebundles.com/review-steam-key-giveaway-zombie-playground/
Take a look at the full Lets Review" video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BpHOP3EPwvw"

Featuring terrible controls, a graphics setting that makes the developer look like they don't know how to make a good game, as well as plenty of unoptimization to fly around for all, this is an interesting one.

After about 14 minutes of playing, this game is the fine definition of mindlessly murder zombies". it offers an objective such as "explore the school!". I clicked on that one assuming it would be a tutorial. No. There is no tutorial.

The next objective: "Kill 10 zombies". These objectives get larger as you go
date: with little to no variety. If you enjoy mindlessly clicking mouse1 while facing zombies
recommended:
this game is for you.

This is the real kicker though. One of the video settings presets is "ALIENWARE". In all caps. Why not just "Maximum"?

This game is unoptimized. It makes a GTX 660 superclocked and intel core i5 3570k jitter between 60fps and 45fps. This is understandable

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Zombie Playground is a RPG childhood nostalgia with zombies in a visceral combat with a school atmosphere.

The game offers singleplayer and multiplayer, to either have fun alone or with others. The game has six different missions to play and challenge your self in the current school area. The equipment option gives a large scale of costumization of your child character, which gives a enjoyment to be the cool kid back in the days. There is currently two classes, which is either a bully as tank or Rascal as a agility class. Every player has a mele weapon aswell for pistols. - And for those who like dogs, then you can get a dog.

While playing the game we notice the EA stage has the same design of zombies everywhere besides the bosses. The school environment is damaged and should be any childs nightmare, but with the skill set and feeling of character control, should not stop them to wipe their asses.

Overall, the game has potential where i can imagine that the game has alot to come in the future. If you want to be young again and beat up everyone including your teacher for giving you homework, then you have the chance to to that repeatedly until you are satisfied.

Here is a demo:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nU2d10Iwwqo

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Take the style of Zombie Ate my Neighbors and throw in a big helping of hack 'n slash and you've got Zombie Playground! While this title has plenty more of development to go, what is there is promising. From the awesome character customization, crazy weaponry, and over the top action, Zombie Playground has plenty of good ideas and shows potential. In the audio/visual department, Zombie Playground is also looking nice. While the game focuses more on slime and less on gore, this doesn't stop it from looking really fun and crazy. The characters animations flow well and combat is highly explosive. What Zombie Playground does lack is simply content and polish. The game has all it's ducks in a row, it just needs to turn itself into a game with a cohesive direction. Goals such as kill 500 zombies isn't necessarily dynamic gameplay, however, this is Early access though. Combat and level design need a little bit more polish but are just about where they need to be. I personally am very excited to see what becomes of this title, with features such as online co-op and possible more fun weapons to slaughter the masses with. This high school drama might be just the kind you want to stay tuned into and see how it all ends.

I made a video preview to show off some of the features and gameplay of this game!
https://youtu.be/nEGR5rqT53A
I hope you enjoy!
Martyr

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Couple of things to keep in mind when deciding on purchasing this game.

1.) It is early access. Understand that means it is not complete. If you can't deal with that, don't buy it. Otherwise, it is a sound purchase for its current status and will only get better. (Many people buy games in this state and expect a fully finished, polished game and then bash it and give bad reviews because it is not complete to their satisfaction. Dont be one of these d0uchebags.)

2.) The developers are fully committed to this game and its success. I know for a fact that they listen to the suggestions of the community which is a great reason for this purchase. How many times does a game feel great and have potential only to find that the devs don't care anymore and/or have given up. This is NOT the case here. This will only get better and better.

3.) Conceptually, this is new. Who doesn't want to run around the halls of their school as a bada$$ kid killing zombies! Get this game NOW!!! You won't be disappointed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

July 30, Early Access Review:

Lots of potential, the gameplay is pretty solid already. With some bug fixes and optimization it will definitely turn into a fun co-op game! There isn't much to unlock at the moment but I'm really enjoying discovering little tricks for my zombie slaying technique :)

Get this if you want a few hours of fun. It'll be difficult at first while you get used to wonky controls and no hand holding. I've cleared every mission except for the first, can't figure out how to get to the area I need to get to! Get this if you want a customized character in the spirit of Splatoon, hip  Squids  kids with attitude. It's almost like Zombies Ate My Neighbors!

Don't get this if you want rewards for your time. Your account levels up but there aren't any rewards implemented currently. Classes do not level up and have no customization outside of the character itself. Currently 2 weapon skins for each weapon type, there may be differences but I haven't noticed any.
Overall:  8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has all the elements of a great rpg/hack-N-slash its criminal. I love everything about this game! The style makes me think Plants Vs Zombies, the combat makes me think good ole beat 'em ups like punch out (in a weird way), and the customization brings the rpg aspect, which keeps the player coming back for more.

**Update:**
This game hasn't been updated since Halloween. I am not certain if the developers are still working on it or have just given up. The game only has 5 quests" to complete
date: and I honestly can't support a game in this state any longer."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am just hoping the game is completed in my lifetime. As a backer on the Kickstarter, i cannot currently recommend this title to anyone. there was only one map, and a character customization when i tried the title for an hour and a half. When playing the school map, the gameplay felt uninteresting to me. here's hoping the game turns out well for other players.

player controls seemed fine though. i used my keyboard and mouse.

Successfully funded on [Kickstarter] Jun 26 2012, i would like to see more (playable?) developments this year.
